intro: Quercus afares var. cerrifolia, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist forests and is valued for its hard, durable wood. Its ecological significance makes it an important component of its native habitats.
